subject: AI & Agents
title: Few-Shot Learning: Teaching by Example
description: A fast breakdown of Few-Shot Learning: Teaching by Example for builders.

hook.text: Show an LLM three examples of the output you want, and it figures out the pattern instantly.

buildup.text: Few-shot prompting includes examples in the prompt to guide the model's behavior.

discovery.text: The model doesn't retrain ‚Äî it uses the examples as in-context patterns to follow.

twist.text: The order and quality of examples matter. Bad examples can mislead the model completely.

climax.text: Zero-shot works too ‚Äî just describe the task. But few-shot is usually more reliable.

punchline.text: Show, don't just tell. AI learns from examples too.

quiz.question: What is few-shot prompting?
options: Including examples in the prompt to guide the model
Training the model on a few data points
Limiting the model to short responses
